notes: First siteswap to learn! Start with one ball in your R hand, and pass it quick to your L hand. Repeat! Only note: the passages must be very quick and horizontal, almost downwards directly to the other hand.
Even easier than **1**! Just hold one ball in your R hand and do nothing... This pattern is asymmetric, you can start with your ball in your L hand instead!

Useful pattern for your first 2 minutes learning juggling. Take one ball on your R hand and pass it to the L hand with a high pass. The pass should pass in front of your eyes. When it land on your L, throw it again to your R and continue. You see the pattern has **00** after the **3**. This means you have time to do something while the ball is in the air. You can try to clap your hands, so to have something like: throw, clap, catch, throw, clap, catch, ...

The 2 balls shower. While not formally juggling, this is the first pattern everyone can juggle when trying to learn. The only note, learn to make a nice **1** keeping your hands at a good distance and throwing the **1** very horizontally, almost downwards. Will help in the future!

Asymmetric version of the two balls shower, or a two balls shower which changes direction continuously. The **3** is always the same ball. A kind of very simple ping-pong. Start 1L 1R; after each **312** you return to have 1L 1R.
Two in one hand. Low-high-wait-low-high-wait. Probably better to learn **40** before..
Play two balls in one hand. Practice both L and R. First step to learn four balls!
Start with both balls in the same hand and throw a high **5** followed by a quick **1**, and repeat. You need to be very quick, not super easy!
The 3 balls cascade and all its many variations.

Hold one ball in one hand (the **2**), and in the other play the other two in a fountain. You can use this as base for a lot of tricks, like moving the ball doing the **2** back and forth, chasing the other balls or “playing” with them.
Half shower box. One ball hops back and forth (the **3**), while the other two hops up and down one in the R and one in the L. The three balls do not mix. Try to make the **4** external.
The 3 balls shower.
A nice pattern. Useful to improve your **1**. See also **4413** and **44133**
An asymmetric version of **441**. Just add a three at the end.
A slower version of **441**. It’s asymmetric.
It’s essentially **3**, but throw higher and keep the other 2 balls in your hands. A slowed down cascade, not much interesting.
A tricky pattern. Think of it as a **5** followed by a quick **31** swap of the other two balls. Keep the **3** low!
Asymmetric version of **531**.

The rhythm of this pattern is strange... "A complete waste of a 5-balls juggler". You can start with two balls in the R and one in the L; throw L first. To enter while doing **3** just throw a 4: ...3334{450}233.. Do the 5 much higher that the 4.
Three out of a 4 fountain. Very easy if you can play **4**.
One hand does the 4 (always the same ball) while the other 3 balls exchange hands with the 53.
One hand does the 4 (always the same ball) while the other 3 balls exchange hands with the 15. Very similar to **4530**.
Concatenate **4512** and **5241**.
The baby-juggling. Two balls are doing *55*, and the third *122*. Not a hard pattern.
5 is always the same ball, the other two do **41401**. I like this pattern!
Nice pattern, not too hard.
3-balls flash (3 out of 5). Can replace the **00** with a clap or a pirouette.
3-balls snake (3 out of 5). Take all three balls in one hand and throw them to the other. Throw the last before catching the first. Repeat. Useful to learn **5** balls. (aka **50505**)
The 4-balls half-shower. Keep it asynchronous!
Nice  asymmetric pattern. You can play it in the middle of the **4** fountain like flashing 4.
Similar to **5551** but symmetric. The same ball is doing the **14** continuously, while the other three are doing the **555**.
High-low-wait-high-low-wait. Balls do not mix, L stay L, and R stay R.
Very similar to **642** but two hands do the same throw each time: low-low-high-high-wait-wait.
